info.name: Incident Management and Security Standards
info.results: ¡Congratulations! Now the world will be a little safer thanks to you...

questions.q: What are cybersecurity policies and procedures and why are they important?

a.option: They are guidelines that establish the rules and steps to follow to protect digital assets and mitigate cyber risks.
They are computer programs that detect and eliminate viruses from the computer.
They are laws that regulate the use of the internet and social networks.
They are online courses that teach about computer security.

questions.q: What types of cybersecurity policies and procedures exist?

a.option: Information security policies, user access and control policies, password policies, etc.
Vacation policies, dress code policies, cafeteria use policies.
Pricing policies, return policies, shipping policies.
Privacy policies, cookie policies, advertising policies.

questions.q: What are the key steps to create and implement security policies?

a.option: Identify objectives, obtain commitment from top management, form a security team, assess risks, develop policies, and apply them.
Purchase antivirus software, install firewalls, hire an ethical hacker.
Perform backups, update software, create an incident response plan
Regularly change passwords, use two-factor authentication, educate employees.

questions.q: ¿Qué es la gestión de contraseñas seguras y por qué es importante?

a.option: It is the practice of creating and using secure and unique passwords for each account, to protect them from unauthorized access.
It is the practice of using the same password for all accounts, to facilitate access.
It is the practice of sharing passwords with friends and family so they can access accounts when needed.
It is the practice of writing passwords on paper and storing them in a secure place.

questions.q: What are the best practices for secure password management?

a.option: Use long and complex passwords, do not reuse them, use a password manager, enable two-factor authentication.
Use short and easy-to-remember passwords, change them frequently, share them with coworkers.
Use the same password for all accounts, write them on paper and store them on the computer.
Do not use passwords, use only biometrics to access accounts.

questions.q: What is security incident management and why is it important?

a.option: It is a process to identify, respond to, and mitigate threats and security events in an organization.
It is software that protects computers from viruses and malware.
It is a set of laws that regulate the use of the internet and social networks.
It is an online course that teaches about computer security.

questions.q: What are the key functions of security incident management?

a.option: Detection, response, investigation, mitigation, and notification.
Purchase antivirus software, install firewalls, hire an ethical hacker.
Perform backups, update software, create an incident response plan.
Regularly change passwords, use two-factor authentication, educate employees.

questions.q: What are security incident management procedures and what do they include?

a.option: They are a set of steps and actions to respond to security incidents, including detection, assessment, classification, containment, mitigation, evidence collection, notification, investigation, recovery, and documentation.
They are policies for internet and social network use in the company.
They are measures to protect computers from viruses and malware.
They are online courses to teach employees about computer security.

questions.q: What is security breach notification and handling?

a.option: It is the process of alerting stakeholders about a security breach and the actions to contain it, investigate, recover, and communicate.
It is software that protects computers from hackers.
It is a set of laws that regulate data privacy.
It is an online course that teaches about computer security.

questions.q: Why is proper notification and handling of security breaches important?

a.option: To comply with regulations, preserve reputation, minimize damage, and improve security.
To save money in the company.
To increase company sales.
To improve the CEO's image of the company.
